course_title: Studies in History: Tales and Fairytales
class_notes:
(Same as FREN 530 1)
FREN 530 Beautiful Freaks: Tales and Fairytales from the Early Modern French Tradition
(Prof. Bruyère / Tuesdays, 1:00-4:00pm in person)
Content: This seminar proposes to revisit texts from the French early modern storytelling tradition by tending to its monstrous appetite for love, death, and a more accommodating world where bodily difference would be less onerous to bear. In addition to close readings of the Cent Nouvelles Nouvelles, Marguerite de Navarre, Catherine Bernard, Madame de Lafayette, Madame D'Aulnoy, D¿Aulnoy, and Charles Perrault, the seminar will also seek to reconnect early-modern storytelling practices with the work of contemporary artists and activists engaged in redefining the good life. Taught in French and English.
course_description: This course focuses on a specific body of literary texts by taking a historical approach to the study of Comparative Literature.  Students may repeat this course for credit if the subject matter varies.
